instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Hi, this computer was brought in with some corrosion on <RESISTOR>R6131</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R6133</RESISTOR>, cleaned the corrosion and tried to start it but still was trying to load, making the chime and turning off... the last thing that happened is that I connected the MagSafe charger and it had a spark on the charging port, now I have a short on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> the computer is not starting anymore and I'm frustrated because of this... Can anyone help?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Do you mean  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>  instead?
That is same as <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, so compare the ohm value with all big coils.
